page.title: 19A BORDON FIREMAN
page.content: My dad is a fireman at Bordon. He has to work shifts of two days eight until six and two nights of six until eight then he gets four full days off in which he likes to go shooting. At seven he showers, has breakfast and starts off on another working day. He drives to the station collecting his daily paper from the newsagents. When he arrives,he signs in and checks what part of the crew he will be that shift (driver etc). Then he starts checking equipment so that they are ready for emergency.Anything missing is recorded in an "occurence" book and to the watch keeper. Then comes theory and practical drills. After lunch the station has to be cleaned from top to bottom. Then the crew change over and he goes home for tea. After watching the news he is ready to work in his garage.
